definition: to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-
low/beneath/to lower (one's head)/to let droop/to hang down/to incline

sentences.english: But small auctions can lead to low winning bids, and thus less profit.
sentences.chinese: 此外，小型拍卖会导致中标价过低，利润从而减少。

sentences.english: China could also clean up environmental damage caused by underpricing resources.
sentences.chinese: 中国也可以治理由于资源定价过低造成的环境破坏。
他们过低估计了他的才能。

sentences.english: He was conscious, slightly hypothermic and appeared to have some frostbite.
sentences.chinese: 他很清醒，略有体温过低的状况，好像还有些冻伤。

sentences.english: Any lower and you'll look like you have a double chin.
sentences.chinese: 若相机位置过低，你就会看起来有双下巴。

sentences.english: At other cases the OD 100 GA measure a too low temperature.
sentences.chinese: 在其他情况下，外径100联大措施过低坦佩叉涂抹。

sentences.english: But it cannot apply to industrial production because of the low-strength.
sentences.chinese: 但是其强度过低，难以达到工业应用的要求。

sentences.english: If the tax is too low to be effective, it can be raised easily.
sentences.chinese: 如果税收过低而没有什么效果，可以很容易地增税。

sentences.english: The cause of end stage renal disease is multifactorial.
sentences.chinese: 出生日时体重过低被推论是末期肾病致病原因之一。

sentences.english: Low clear height also makes people feel depressed.
sentences.chinese: 净高过低还使人感到压抑。

sentences.english: I think we should live low-carbon life.
sentences.chinese: 我认为我们应该过低碳生活。

sentences.english: Offer too low will not be responsed.
sentences.chinese: 过低的报价可能不会被回复。

sentences.english: The challenges they face include hypothermia and death by drowning.
sentences.chinese: 他们也面临体温过低和溺水的危险。

sentences.english: If your blood sugar is low, you may feel compromised even with half a drink.
sentences.chinese: 如果你的血糖过低，你喝了一半酒就会感觉不适了。

sentences.english: If pressure is lower, the goal of depth profile control can't be achieved.
sentences.chinese: 如果控制过低，挤入总量往往达不到深度调剖的目的。

sentences.english: A low blood sugar level is called hypoglycemia.
sentences.chinese: 血糖浓度过低则被称为低糖血症。

definition: to be on the low side/to be inadequate (e.g. of a salary)
to be on the high side/to be unusually high
low/beneath/to lower (one's head)/to let droop/to hang down/to incline
to lead to/to create/to cause/to bring about
range (the difference between the lowest and highest values)
to decline/to drop/to fall/to go down/to decrease
